meanings.definition: A hereditary military dictator of Japan
meanings.sent1: The shogun led the army into battle.
meanings.sent2: The shogun's rule was respected by all.
meanings.sent3: The shogun decided to wear a funny hat to the war council.
meanings.sent4: In the company, he was the shogun of sales strategies.
meanings.sent5: The image of the shogun on horseback was etched in history books.

meanings.definition: A person who holds absolute power or authority
meanings.sent1: As the CEO, she was the shogun of the company.
meanings.sent2: The political shogun made all the decisions.
meanings.sent3: The birthday girl felt like the shogun of the party with all the attention.
meanings.sent4: He became the shogun of the kitchen, dictating the menu for the night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was the shogun of the classroom, guiding the students with wisdom.
